Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to request the following information under the Freedom of Information Act.
1. The number of people who have been housed in temporary accommodation, who made homelessness or emergency applications in each of the past five years.
Please provide a breakdown for:
2020-2021
2021-2022
2022-2023
2023-present
2. The number of people in each of the different types of temporary accommodation who made homelessness or emergency applications in each of the past five years.
By 'type of temporary accommodation' I mean hostels, B and Bs, council properties, private rentals, etc.
The answer to this could look something like this:
2020 x in Hostels; y in private rentals, etc
Please provide a breakdown for:
2020-2021
2021-2022
2022-2023
2023-present
3. The average length of time people spent in temporary accommodation who made homelessness or emergency applications in each of the past five years.
Please provide a breakdown for:
2020-2021
2021-2022
2022-2023
2023-present
4. The gross cost to the council of temporary accommodation for people who made homelessness or emergency applications in each of the past five years.
Please provide a breakdown of costs for each year by each type of accommodation (2011 £x on Hostels; £y on private rentals, etc.)
Please provide a breakdown for:
2020-2021
2021-2022
2022-2023
2023-present
5. The gross cost of payments to private companies/private individuals who provided temporary accommodation for people who made homelessness or emergency applications in each of the past five years.
(e.g landlords who own hostels that are used as temporary accommodation; private companies that run centres, etc).
Please provide the names of these private companies/individuals and details of all payments made to each over the last five years. (e.g Company X received £x in 2012, £y in 2013)
I would like this information in electronic form, preferably as a CSV file.
If my request is denied in whole or in part, I ask that you justify
all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the act.
Please let me know you have received this.
Yours faithfully,
Laura FitzPatrick

Dear Laura FitzPatrick,
Thank you for your request for information relating to temporary
accommodation statistics which we received on 25/10/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 22/11/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Laura FitzPatrick,
Thank you for your request for information relating to temporary
accommodation statistics which we received on 25/10/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. The number of people who have been housed in temporary accommodation,
who made homelessness or emergency applications in each of the past five
years.
Please provide a breakdown for:
2020-2021: 973
2021-2022: 1,113
2022-2023: 1,357
2023-present: 686
Please note that we have not provided the number of people as we cannot
with any assurance of accuracy. The figure is of households. For
‘2023-present’ our data is up to the end of September, as that’s when
we’ve done our data quality work up to.
2. The number of people in each of the different types of temporary
accommodation who made homelessness or emergency applications in each of
the past five years. By 'type of temporary accommodation' I mean hostels,
B and Bs, council properties, private rentals, etc.
The answer to this could look something like this:
2020 x in Hostels; y in private rentals, etc Please provide a breakdown
for:
2020-2021: 403 in council accommodation, 23 in registered provider
accommodation, 824 in bed and breakfast or hotels
2021-2022: 497 in council accommodation, 850 in bed and breakfast or
hotels
2022-2023: 605 in council accommodation, 1,183 in bed and breakfast or
hotels
2023-present: 264 in council accommodation, 629 in bed and breakfast or
hotels
Please note that there are households that fall into more than one
category, as they may stay in more than one accommodation type while they
are being housed.
3. The average length of time people spent in temporary accommodation who
made homelessness or emergency applications in each of the past five
years.
Please provide a breakdown for:
2020-2021: 132 days
2021-2022: 150 days
2022-2023: 130 days
2023-present: 80 days
The figures for 2022/23 and 2023/24 are lower as there are households who
are still in open Temporary Accommodation placements. By way of example,
for all current households in TA the average length of stay is 123 days.
In all cases we’ve counted applicants who presented as homeless or
threatened with homeless in the financial year indicated.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
